title: Retaking The Capital
opening: After rescuing Fa, Roy headed for Aquleia.
The capitol of Etruria, Aquleia is also the largest, most prosperous city on
Preparing for the Lycia Alliance Army's attack, the Coup d'etat army
Originally they had planned on using the garrison of the city for defense, but
since the Elimine Church had turned to Roy's side, the Coup d'etat army had no
choice but to retreat to the castle and take post there instead for fear that
the Church may have encouraged the city denizens to protest.
The Elimine Church was started by "Saint" Elimine, one of the Eight Heroes.
This religious organization had many followers, primarily in Bern and Etruria.
Roy had gained the Church's support in attacking Aquleia.  However, Narcian and
his elite troops were waiting for Roy inside the castle.

intro.speaker: Narcian
intro.line: Damn...! The Lycia Alliance Army still stands! How could they come this far...!

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: G-General Narcian... The leader of the Three Dragon Lords, Lord Murdock is here!

intro.speaker: Narcian
intro.line: What!? H-Hurry! Send someone out to escort him here! Make sure he gets the utmost attention...

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: He already is here...

intro.speaker: Murdock
intro.line: Enough. Step aside.

intro.speaker: Narcian
intro.line: L-Lord Murdock... What a pleasant surprise! What brings you all the way from Ilia?

intro.speaker: Murdock
intro.line: Narcian, I believe you owe me an explanation.

intro.speaker: Narcian
intro.line: I-I’m sorry, my lord, I’m not sure I understand...

intro.speaker: Murdock
intro.line: Princess Guinevere has escaped, again. Flaer, your lieutenant, has failed at Western Isles. Also, you have neglected your mission of capturing the hidden village in Nabata, as given by the king himself! Narcian! I want explanations. Now!

intro.speaker: Narcian
intro.line: Y-Yes... Well, you see, my lord, there have been many complications, and...

intro.speaker: Murdock
intro.line: ...Enough. I have orders from the king. You are to be demoted from Dragon Lord status.

intro.speaker: Narcian
intro.line: What!?

intro.speaker: Murdock
intro.line: His Majesty wants Galle to take your place.

intro.speaker: Narcian
intro.line: M-My lord! Please wait! One more chance, please! Just give me one more chance!

intro.speaker: Murdock
intro.line: ...The Lycia Alliance Army is approaching this palace. Stop them to show me your worth. If you succeed, I shall negotiate with the king.

intro.speaker: Narcian
intro.line: Lord Murdock...

intro.speaker: Murdock
intro.line: Narcian... Don’t fail the king...or me, again.

intro.speaker: Narcian
intro.line: Rubbish! Me, demoted!? And my replacement is that Galle...! Never! I will never allow that to happen! B-But what can I do... No...! My honor, my status... It’s all collapsing!

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: General Narcian, the enemy is approaching...

intro.speaker: Narcian
intro.line: Shut up! I know that. ...Wait. The brother of that traitor, Melady, was here, wasn’t he... Ah! I can say that we failed because he was working with his sister to leak information to the enemy, and kill him off later! Hehehe...

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: General Narcian... What are you thinking?

intro.speaker: Narcian
intro.line: Hm? Oh, do you know Melady’s younger brother?

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Do you mean Sir Zeiss?

intro.speaker: Narcian
intro.line: Right, Zeiss. Anyway, he’s suspected of leaking information to the Lycia Alliance Army. Capture him and bring him here.

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: What? But Sir Zeiss would never do something like that...

intro.speaker: Narcian
intro.line: Shut up! All you must do is follow my orders! Now bring him here!

intro.speaker: Arcard
intro.line: T-The enemy is right at our doorstep!

intro.speaker: Roartz
intro.line: Oh...what must we do! If we get caught, we shall be prosecuted as the initiators of the coup d’etat...!

intro.speaker: Roartz
intro.line: ...Arcard! This is all your fault! If you had done your duty and gotten rid of the Lycia Alliance Army at Djuto...

intro.speaker: Arcard
intro.line: B-But Lord Roartz...! ...No! This is not the time to be arguing, my lord! We must escape!

intro.speaker: Roartz
intro.line: But escape to where...

intro.speaker: Arcard
intro.line: ...Let us turn to Bern! This was originally their plan...

intro.speaker: Roartz
intro.line: Y-Yes, of course! We have done what they asked of us. They would be sure to help us.

intro.speaker: Douglas
intro.line: ...May I ask what you intend to do with the king?

intro.speaker: Roartz
intro.line: Er... W-Well, I’m sure they wouldn’t harm the king. After all, King Zephiel’s mother was an Etrurian. Anyway, Douglas, you must escape as well...

intro.speaker: Douglas
intro.line: I refuse. I was originally fighting alongside you because King Mordred’s safety was at stake. I had no intention of going along with your plans.

intro.speaker: Roartz
intro.line: Hmph! Stubborn as always, I see. Suit yourself. Arcard, let us escape!

intro.speaker: Arcard
intro.line: Lord Roartz! Please wait...

intro.speaker: Douglas
intro.line: ...Dirty traitors! Fleeing at the last minute... It must have been easy for Bern to seduce them. I suppose I can leave those two to the Lycia Alliance Army... If Prince Mildain returns...Etruria will pull itself together again. And until then... I shall fight and prove my loyalty as the Great General of Etruria!

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: Master Roy, this is the palace of Aquleia. According to the information we have gathered, the Revolutionaries have holed up inside.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Bishop Yoder, I thank you for your help. Thanks to the Elimine Church, we were able to avoid fighting in the city and killing innocent people.

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: No, I must thank you. Our order was being persecuted by the Revolutionaies, so if you hadn’t come along to fight, we would have been driven out of the land a long time ago.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Persecuted? Why?

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: Most likely because we were investigating into Bern’s Dragons. Saint Elimine, our founder, said this before she ascended to heaven: ‘Never allow the Dragons to be brought back to the world... It would spell death for many a people.’ Therefore, we are making our best efforts to find a way to send the Dragons back to the world in which they belong.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: If the Revolutionaries had joined Bern, then they would naturally want to stop you...

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: That’s right. Also, we found out this: The resurrection of the Dragons is somehow tied to the Fire Emblem, Bern’s greatest treasure. That was where I sent Saul and Dorothy to investigate.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: I see.

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: Master Roy, you must stop the Revolutionaries. And if you would allow me to give you further advice, I would suggest that you do not do any unnecessary killing. I am sure there are troops that had no choice but to join the Revolutionaries due to inside reasons.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Yes.

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: May Saint Elimine bless you, Master Roy.

battle.speaker: Zeiss
battle.line: I’m here, Sir Galle. Is something wrong? Why did you summon me here...

battle.speaker: Galle
battle.line: There is no time to be explaining the details. Zeiss, you must hide.

battle.speaker: Zeiss
battle.line: ...What do you mean? The enemy is right in front of us!

battle.speaker: Galle
battle.line: Zeiss, listen to me. Just now, General Narcian gave an order to the entire army...to capture you.

battle.speaker: Zeiss
battle.line: What!? Does he think that I am betraying Bern?

battle.speaker: Galle
battle.line: He is trying to put the responsibility for all of his past failures on your shoulders. He is saying that you worked with Melady to leak information to the enemy.

battle.speaker: Zeiss
battle.line: With my sister? We don’t even know where she is.

battle.speaker: Galle
battle.line: Melady has apparently joined the Lycia Alliance Army with the Princess.

battle.speaker: Zeiss
battle.line: !! Melady turned to the enemy!? I don’t believe it...

battle.speaker: Galle
battle.line: Then get the story from her yourself. I want to go with you as well, but I have been told by Lord Murdock to observe the battle and report back to him. Zeiss, I want you escape when you see the chance and speak with Melady.

battle.speaker: Galle
battle.line: I do not intend on doing anything until we hear Melady’s story.

battle.speaker: Hugh
battle.line: What the? The Etrurian nobles ran off? Wait a minute, then what happens to my payment? I haven’t been paid for this mission yet!

battle.speaker: Cath
battle.line: The treasures are calling me! So this is the palace of the richest family in Elibe... The treasure must be something indeed. Well, they took it all from us in the first place, so I guess I’ll only be taking it back!

recruit-talk.speaker: Melady
recruit-talk.line: Zeiss!? What are you doing here?

recruit-talk.speaker: Zeiss
recruit-talk.line: Sir Galle said that you had joined the enemy. But I couldn’t believe it until now, when I can see it with my own eyes! Why! Why did you betray Bern?

recruit-talk.speaker: Melady
recruit-talk.line: I never betrayed Bern. I just wanted to help Princess Guinevere.

recruit-talk.speaker: Zeiss
recruit-talk.line: So you threw away everything...your homeland, your family, even your lover...for the princess. For that...stubborn princess who betrayed her own brother!

recruit-talk.speaker: Melady
recruit-talk.line: Enough, Zeiss! I will not tolerate you insulting Princess Guinevere!

recruit-talk.speaker: Melady
recruit-talk.line: It’s the princess, not the king, who is truly working for the good of Bern. Granted, I was angry when the princess left without consulting me at all. But now that I’m by her side, I understand more than ever...that she had not made a mistake.

recruit-talk.speaker: Zeiss
recruit-talk.line: He said that he didn’t intend on doing anything until he heard your story.

recruit-talk.speaker: Zeiss
recruit-talk.line: I don’t fully agree with you yet, but... I know I can trust you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Zeiss
recruit-talk.line: If the Lycia Alliance Army’s leader would allow it, I want to go with you. I want to see the princess’ beliefs that moved you so.

battle-talk.speaker: Elffin
battle-talk.line: Douglas!

battle-talk.speaker: Douglas
battle-talk.line: Prince Mildain! You’ve returned! You seem so well now...thank goodness.

battle-talk.speaker: Elffin
battle-talk.line: It is all thanks to you. I am sorry I put you through this.

battle-talk.speaker: Douglas
battle-talk.line: You returned safely... That is more than enough praise.

battle-talk.speaker: Elffin
battle-talk.line: Douglas, I am currently working with the Lycia Alliance Army.

battle-talk.speaker: Douglas
battle-talk.line: Ah! Then everything will go smoothly as long as we can drive off Bern’s troops from the palace.

battle-talk.speaker: Elffin
battle-talk.line: What...are you going to do?

battle-talk.speaker: Douglas
battle-talk.line: The king is still in the enemy’s hands. If I turn against Bern now, the king would be in danger...

battle-talk.speaker: Douglas
battle-talk.line: But now that you have returned, I have no more regrets, even if I were to be defeated by the Lycia Alliance Army.

battle-talk.speaker: Elffin
battle-talk.line: Douglas...I apologize. You are doing this all for my father...

battle-talk.speaker: Douglas
battle-talk.line: My Prince, if my life were to be used for the true benefit of Etruria, then that would be my last wish.

battle-talk.speaker: Douglas
battle-talk.line: I am glad that I could see you alive before my death.

battle-talk.speaker: Elffin
battle-talk.line: You risked your life to protect me and let me escape to the Western Isles. I shall never forget that. ...Never.

battle-talk.speaker: Douglas
battle-talk.line: ...I still have false hope. I still think of trying to take you to see the king...

battle-talk.speaker: Elffin
battle-talk.line: ...Douglas, I will not give up hope. Roy...he just might be able to...

battle-talk.speaker: Larum
battle-talk.line: Father!

battle-talk.speaker: Douglas
battle-talk.line: Larum! What are you doing here?

battle-talk.speaker: Larum
battle-talk.line: I joined the Lycia Alliance Army with Prince Mildain...

battle-talk.speaker: Douglas
battle-talk.line: ! So the prince has returned! Now Etruria has hope...

battle-talk.speaker: Larum
battle-talk.line: Father...

battle-talk.speaker: Douglas
battle-talk.line: Larum... I’m sorry I put you through this. I had to send you off along to protect the prince.

battle-talk.speaker: Larum
battle-talk.line: No! That was what I wanted to do.

battle-talk.speaker: Douglas
battle-talk.line: ...But just when I thought I had saved you from a hard life, I had to send you out to be a dancer again.

battle-talk.speaker: Larum
battle-talk.line: ...You saved me from that terrible life with no food...no money... And you even raised me as your own daughter... From that time, I made up my mind that I would one day return the gift, that I would be of some use to you.

battle-talk.speaker: Douglas
battle-talk.line: Larum...

battle-talk.speaker: Larum
battle-talk.line: So I’m really...glad, now. I’m finally being useful to you...

battle-talk.speaker: Douglas
battle-talk.line: Larum, thank you. ...Please take care of the prince from now on as well.

battle-talk.speaker: Larum
battle-talk.line: What about you? You’re not coming with us?

battle-talk.speaker: Douglas
battle-talk.line: King Mordred is still in the hands of the enemy. If I turn to Lycia Alliance Army now, then the king’s life would be in danger.

battle-talk.speaker: Larum
battle-talk.line: ...But still...

battle-talk.speaker: Douglas
battle-talk.line: Now that the prince has returned safely, I have no regrets, even I am to be taken down by the Lycia Alliance Army.

battle-talk.speaker: Douglas
battle-talk.line: Now go. If you are seen with me, you would be suspected of treachery. No matter where you are, you will always be my true daughter. Always.

battle-talk.speaker: Larum
battle-talk.line: Father...

battle-talk.speaker: Douglas
battle-talk.line: May your life be blessed with happiness...

battle-talk.speaker: Douglas
battle-talk.line: Cecilia.

battle-talk.speaker: Cecilia
battle-talk.line: Lord Douglas... Why is someone of your stature fighting for the Revolutionaries...?

battle-talk.speaker: Douglas
battle-talk.line: I am prioritizing the king’s safety. That is all.

battle-talk.speaker: Cecilia
battle-talk.line: But if this continues, Etruria will become a puppet state for Bern! There must be a nation for there to be a king. If the nation falls, so will its power. And in the end, all will be forgotten!

battle-talk.speaker: Douglas
battle-talk.line: If this nation is doomed to collapse...then so be it. But I will assure the king’s safety!

battle-talk.speaker: Cecilia
battle-talk.line: What...! We must fight for our people, for our nation! The Etrurian army is for the people. They are not the king’s private soldiers!

battle-talk.speaker: Douglas
battle-talk.line: ...It is a matter of opinion. Cecilia, you must follow your beliefs, as I must follow mine.

battle-talk.speaker: Percival
battle-talk.line: Lord Douglas!

battle-talk.speaker: Douglas
battle-talk.line: Percival... I see no more hesitation in your eyes now.

battle-talk.speaker: Percival
battle-talk.line: Lord Douglas, it is thanks to you. Because you saved Prince Mildain, I was able to return to being an honorable knight again.

battle-talk.speaker: Douglas
battle-talk.line: Good.

battle-talk.speaker: Percival
battle-talk.line: What are you going to do, Lord Douglas?

battle-talk.speaker: Douglas
battle-talk.line: The king is still in the hands of the enemy. If I turn to Lycia Alliance Army now, then the king’s life would be in danger.

battle-talk.speaker: Douglas
battle-talk.line: Now that the prince has returned, I have no regrets, even if I am to be taken down by the Lycia Alliance Army.

battle-talk.speaker: Percival
battle-talk.line: I knew you would say that, my lord.

battle-talk.speaker: Douglas
battle-talk.line: Well, you have walked the same path as I. Please take care of the prince...and of Etruria.

battle-talk.speaker: Percival
battle-talk.line: Yes. I shall dedicate my life to them.

boss.speaker: Narcian
boss.line: I am strong...I am wise...I am handsome...and I am right. Always! More than anybody!

boss.speaker: Narcian
boss.line: No…No…! I will not be defeated…! Not by you…worthless… Gaaaaaaahhhhh!

boss.speaker: Narcian
boss.line: You...! You’re that girl that was...!

boss.speaker: Clarine
boss.line: ? Excuse me, have we met before?

boss.speaker: Narcian
boss.line: What! You have forgotten me, of all people!? That...must not be!

boss.speaker: Zeiss
boss.line: General Narcian... No, Narcian! I heard everything from Sir Galle! Do you not...have any honor left in you at all!

boss.speaker: Narcian
boss.line: Galle...! Dammit, is he ever an eyesore! Well, it shall be fine... Once I get rid of you, everything will be shrouded in mystery...

boss.speaker: Narcian
boss.line: You’re... So, being defeated once wasn’t enough?

boss.speaker: Cecilia
boss.line: Zephiel was the one who defeated me. Not you.

boss.speaker: Narcian
boss.line: Then I shall show you my strength now!

boss.speaker: Narcian
boss.line: Well, if it isn’t General Percival, the traitor!

boss.speaker: Percival
boss.line: Joining you...was the biggest mistake of my life. And now, I shall repent for it...by defeating you!

end.speaker: Mordred
end.line: So it is you...who rescued us?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: My name is Roy, leader of the Lycia Alliance Army.

end.speaker: Mordred
end.line: Hm...

end.speaker: Mordred
end.line: ...I must ask you of something. The soldiers who have been working with Bern have taken over the Tower of the Saint.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: The Tower of the Saint... That is where Saint Elimine’s altar lies.

end.speaker: Mordred
end.line: Yes... That is a national symbol of Etruria. Please, I ask you to recapture the tower.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: I will do what I can.

end.speaker: Mordred
end.line: I am sorry. You may use anything in the tower that you find useful.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: The king... He still mourns the prince’s death.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: He must have been an easy target for Bern.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: I want to help him...but how?

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: Father...I am sorry. When the time comes, I will return...I promise.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Princess Guinevere, I must speak with you.

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: ...Is it that we must attack Bern as well after Etruria?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ! Did someone inform you?

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: No. ...But I knew that it would happen eventually.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ...We cannot leave Bern running around freely any longer. I know that it will be hard to see your nation invaded, but...

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: ...Roy, I will give this to you.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: What is this?

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: It is Bern’s greatest treasure...the Fire Emblem.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: What!?

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: In the south of Bern lies a temple called the Temple of Seals. In it lies the sword that our founder, Hartmut, used.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Is it...one of the Divine Weapons?

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: I believe so. It was a sword made to slay the Dark Dragon, the leader of the Dragons during the Scouring. However, it held power so immense that it was sealed away after the war. The Fire Emblem is the key to break its seal.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: The key...

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: My brother...is trying to force the world into submission through power. That is not forgivable, no matter what the reason.

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: To stop him, all we can do is defeat the Dragon at his side.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Princess Guinevere...

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: ...My name shall be stained in history, as the woman who betrayed her nation.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: No...

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: I shall be hated all my life as a traitor. Roy, promise me one thing. When we invade Bern, promise me that you will not harm the civilians...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: I promise. Please trust me.

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: ...Thank you.
